product_metadata.title: Term Insurance with Return of Premium (TROP)
product_metadata.target_audience: Individuals looking for maturity benefits along with protection

product_summary.objective: To provide life cover with a maturity benefit where premiums are refunded if the life assured survives the policy term.
highlights: Refund of total premiums paid on maturity
Death benefit if insured passes away
Zero admission of cost feature (Zero Cost Term Plan is different, but TROP is effectively zero cost if survived)

plan_variants.description: Standard term insurance with the added benefit of premium refund at maturity.

core_benefits.description: Sum assured paid to the nominee if the insured passes away during the policy tenure.
Total premiums paid are refunded if the insured survives the policy tenure.
Premiums eligible for deduction under Section 80C. Maturity benefit (refund) tax-free under Section 10(10D) subject to conditions.

discounts: 16% Discount on 1st year premium (mentioned in summary)

services: Discounts on Medicines and Lab Bookings

sample_illustrations.description: Ravi, 30 years, Sum Assured ₹50 Lakhs, Policy Term 25 years, Regular Pay

compliance_rules.disclaimer: Insurance is subject to terms and conditions. Please read the sales brochure and policy document carefully before purchase.
compliance_rules.fraud_warning: BEWARE of spurious phone calls and fraudulent offers. IRDAI does not sell policies or announce bonuses.
compliance_rules.tax_disclaimer: Tax benefits are subject to provisions of Section 80C and Section 10(10D) of the Income Tax Act, 1961. Consult your tax advisor.

retrieval_chunks.text: Term Insurance with Return of Premium (TROP) offers a dual benefit: life cover for protection and a refund of premiums as a maturity benefit.
If the insured dies, the family gets the sum assured. If they survive the term, they get back all premiums paid (excluding taxes/rider premiums).
Premiums are tax-deductible under Section 80C coverage. Maturity proceeds (premium refund) are generally tax-free under Section 10(10D).
Riders like Critical Illness and Accidental Death Benefit can be added for comprehensive coverage.
Example: A 30-year-old paying ~₹5,847 p.a. for ₹50 Lakh cover for 25 years receives ~₹1.5 Lakhs back on maturity.
